transcripts.text: So here we are at the 18th Police District in Philadelphia with my friend Keith from Philly News Now, who had a little run in with these guys about a year or so ago.  And he wanted to thank them for their wonderful treatment they gave of him when he had an encounter with them.  So we're going to stop by and say hello.  All right, so I guess we have to go to the corner or we just go across?
Well, we could do like Philly do or we could do the right thing.

Yeah, they're going to cry and get all butthurt so we can miles across legally.  Why they're going to cry and get butthurt is beyond me.  You know, it amazes me.  They take a public position that gets paid very well knowing they're under the scrutiny of the public.  But yet, when the public shines a light on them, they fucking cry.  Amazing.  Uh-uh.  Scary camera.  Yeah, well, when you're doing illegal things, cameras are very scary.  Hi, guys.  Happy Easter.  all right you don't see any signs that say you can't go in.  no and you've already been in this lot before.  yes i have after the fact nice you don't see any signs either.  that's a uh no entrance Interesting.  We got another entrance over here, or exit.
There's three ways into this lot.
So I guess police are allowed to park on the curb?
Or on the sidewalk, I mean.
Yeah, but I wouldn't, you know, look too much into it.  Everybody parks on the sidewalk here.

I guess that's true.  ... ... ... ... ... Keep the cars somewhat clean, that's a plus.
